nodes.name: DocumentToText
nodes.description: The DocumentToText node extracts text content from documents, including PDF, TXT, DOCX, and image files, located in a specified file path or directory. It processes either a single file or an entire directory, producing a structured DataFrame with columns for the extracted text, file name, page numbers, and optionally, base64-encoded data for PDFs and images.
nodes.details:
DocumentToText Node Details


The DocumentToText node extracts text content from documents, including PDF, TXT, DOCX, and image files, located in a specified file path or directory. It processes either a single file or an entire directory, producing a structured DataFrame with columns for the extracted text, file name, page numbers, and optionally, base64-encoded data for PDFs and images.


General:



Directory/File Path:
Specifies the path to a single document file or a directory containing multiple documents. This field is required and must be accessible to the PySpark engine.

Document Type:
Selects the types of documents to process. Options include:

  • pdf: Processes PDF files, extracting text and optionally converting pages to base64-encoded images.
  • txt: Processes plain text files, extracting text only.
  • docx: Processes Microsoft Word documents, extracting text only.
  • image: Processes image files (e.g., PNG, JPEG) for text extraction via OCR, with optional base64 encoding.
If left empty, the node processes all supported file types (PDF, TXT, DOCX, and images) in the specified path.


Select Image Column:
Specifies a column containing paths to image files when processing images. This is optional and only required if image paths are provided in a DataFrame column rather than the directory path.

Image Encoding:
Determines whether to include a column with base64-encoded data for PDFs and images. Options are:
  • true: Adds a column with base64-encoded representations of PDF pages and image files.
  • false: Does not include base64-encoded data (default).
Note: TXT and DOCX files are not converted to base64 encodings, even if this option is enabled.


Recursive Processing:


Recursive:
Controls whether the node processes documents in subdirectories. Options are:
  • true: Recursively processes all documents in the specified directory and its subdirectories.
  • false: Processes only documents directly in the specified directory (default).

Output Storage:


Save Images Directory Path:
Specifies a directory path to save extracted images (for PDFs and image files) when Image Encoding is enabled. This is optional and relevant for storing extracted image data.

Output:


The node outputs a DataFrame with the following default columns:

  • fileName: The name of the source file.
  • content: The extracted text content from the document.
  • pageNumber:> The page number of the extracted content (for multi-page documents like PDFs; single-page documents like TXT, DOCX, and images use page number 1).
  • If Image Encoding is set to true, a base64ImageData column is included for PDFs and images, containing base64-encoded representations of the pages or images. TXT and DOCX files will have null in this column.
nodes.examples:
Example: DocumentToText Node


Input:

A directory /data/documents/ contains the following files:
- report.pdf (a 2-page PDF document)
- notes.txt (a plain text file)
- proposal.docx (a Microsoft Word document)
- chart.png (an image file with text)

The DocumentToText node is configured as follows:
  • Directory/File Path: /data/documents/
  • Document Type: ["pdf", "txt", "docx", "image"] (process all supported types)
  • Select Image Column: Empty (no specific image column; uses file path for images)
  • Image Encoding: true (includes base64-encoded data for PDFs and images)
  • Recursive: false (processes only files in the specified directory)
  • Save Images Directory Path: /data/output/images/

Output:

The node processes the files and produces a DataFrame with the following structure:

fileName | content | pageNumber | base64ImageData
---------------|--------------------------------------|------------|----------------------------------
report.pdf | This is page 1 of the report... | 1 | iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUg...
report.pdf | This is page 2 of the report... | 2 | iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUg...
notes.txt | Meeting notes: discuss project... | 1 | null
proposal.docx | Proposal for new project... | 1 | null
chart.png | Sales: Q1 2025... | 1 | iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUg...

Explanation:

- The report.pdf file is processed, extracting text from both pages, resulting in two rows (one per page). With Image Encoding set to true, each page is also converted to a base64-encoded image in the base64ImageData column.
- The notes.txt file is processed as a single-page document, with its text extracted into the content column. No base64 encoding is applied, so base64ImageData is null.
- The proposal.docx file is processed, extracting its text content into a single row. No base64 encoding is applied, so base64ImageData is null.
- The chart.png file is processed using OCR to extract text, and its base64-encoded image data is included in the base64ImageData column.
- Extracted images from the PDF and PNG files are saved to /data/output/images/.
- Since Recursive is set to false, only files directly in /data/documents/ are processed.

nodes.name: Multi LLM Query
nodes.description: The Multi LLM Query node is designed to query multiple large language models (LLMs) from providers such as OpenAI, Bedrock, and Gemini, using a DataFrame as input. It processes user queries, text content, and/or base64-encoded images to generate responses based on the selected model and task, producing a structured DataFrame output.
nodes.details:
Multi LLM Query Node Details


The Multi LLM Query node is designed to query multiple large language models (LLMs) from providers such as OpenAI, Bedrock, and Gemini, using a DataFrame as input. It processes user queries, text content, and/or base64-encoded images to generate responses based on the selected model and task, producing a structured DataFrame output.

General:


Select Task:

Specifies the task to perform. Options include:
- summary: Generates a summary of the content in bullet points.
- translation: Translates the content to English.
- topic_extraction: Extracts key topics from the content.
- other: Allows for a custom task defined by the user.

Prompt:

Allows users to provide a custom prompt / instructions for the selected task.

Content Column:

Specifies the DataFrame column containing the text content to be processed. Required for text or text+image modes.

Model Selection:

Selects the LLM provider to use. Options are:
- openai: Uses OpenAI models (e.g., gpt-4o).
- bedrock: Uses AWS Bedrock models (e.g., Claude models).
- gemini: Uses Google Gemini models (e.g., gemini-1.5-flash-latest).

Select Connection:

Specifies the connection details for the selected LLM provider (e.g., API keys for OpenAI/Gemini, AWS credentials for Bedrock). Required to authenticate and access the chosen model.

Temperature:

Controls the randomness of the LLM's output. Default is 0.7. Higher values increase creativity, while lower values ensure more deterministic responses.

Image Column:

Specifies the DataFrame column containing base64-encoded images. Required for image or text+image modes.

Mode Selection:

Determines the input mode for the LLM. Options are:
- text: Processes text-only input from the content column or custom prompt.
- image: Processes base64-encoded images from the image column.
- text+image: Processes both text and base64-encoded images.

Timeout (seconds):

Specifies the maximum time (in seconds) to wait for the model response. Visible when OpenAI or Gemini is selected.

Thinking Budget:

Controls the computational budget (e.g., steps or tokens) for Gemini models. Only visible when Gemini is selected.

Advanced:


Aggregate Response:

Specifies how to aggregate input data before processing. Options are:
- none: Processes each row individually, retaining fileName and pageNumber (if provided).
- all: Aggregates all rows into a single response.
- perfile: Aggregates rows by fileName, producing one response per file.

Number of Partitions:

Specifies the number of Spark partitions for distributed processing. Default is 3.

File Name Column:

Specifies the DataFrame column containing file names. Required for perfile aggregation mode.

Page Number Column:

Specifies the DataFrame column containing page numbers (e.g., for PDFs). Optional, used for row-wise processing with none aggregation mode.

Output:

The node outputs a DataFrame with columns based on the aggregation mode:
- none: Includes fileName (if provided), pageNumber (if provided), and response.
- perfile: Includes fileName and response.
- all: Includes only the response column.
The response column contains the LLM-generated text or error messages if the API call fails.
nodes.examples:
Multi LLM Query Node Examples


Input:

A DataFrame contains the following data:
- fileName: ["doc1.pdf", "doc1.pdf", "doc2.pdf"]
- pageNumber: ["1", "2", null]
- content: ["Article about climate change...", "Climate change impacts...", "Renewable energy report..."]
- imageBase64: [null, "iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUg...", null]

The Multi LLM Query node is configured as follows:
- Select Task: summary
- Prompt: "Summarize the content in bullet points."
- Content Column: content
- Model Selection: openai
- Select Connection: Configured with valid OpenAI API key
- Temperature: 0.7
- Timeout (seconds): 90
- Image Column: imageBase64
- Mode Selection: text+image
- Aggregate Response: perfile
- Number of Partitions: 3
- File Name Column: fileName
- Page Number Column: pageNumber

Output:

The node processes the DataFrame and produces a DataFrame with the following structure:
- fileName: doc1.pdf
response:
- Climate change effects on ecosystems
- Rising temperatures

- fileName: doc2.pdf
response:
- Renewable energy advancements
- Solar and wind adoption

fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.title: Select Connection
fields.description: Select Connection

fields.name: temperature
fields.title: Temperature
fields.description: Temperature setting for the model (default: 0).

fields.name: contentCol
fields.title: Content Column
fields.description: Column name for the text content.

fields.name: imageCol
fields.title: Image Column
fields.description: Column name for the base 64 image.

fields.name: inputMode
fields.title: Mode Selection
fields.description: Select the model to use (text, image, text+image).

fields.name: task
fields.title: Select Prompt
fields.description: Specify the task to perform: summary, translation, topic extraction, or other.

optionsMap.translation: Translate the following content to default language
optionsMap.topic_extraction: Extract key topics from the following content.

fields.name: customPrompt
fields.value: Ensure that no extra spaces, delimiters, comments, or explanations are added. Replace "tone" values dynamically based on the conversation, but always keep this compact JSON structure.
fields.title: Prompt
fields.description: Custom prompt to override the default instructions.

fields.name: userQueryCol
fields.title: User Query Column
fields.description: Column name for user query, (if the query is in a column)

fields.name: numPartitions
fields.title: Number of Partitions
fields.description: Number of Partitions

fields.name: fileNameCol
fields.title: File Name Column
fields.description: Select File Name Column

fields.name: pageNumberCol
fields.title: Page Number Column
fields.description: Select Page Number column.

fields.name: timeout
fields.title: Timeout (seconds)
fields.description: Maximum time to wait for Openai and Gemini API response

fields.name: thinkingBudget
fields.title: Thinking Budget
fields.description: Configure the Gemini thinking budget by specifying the number of tokens to allocate for thinking. For Flash and Flash Lite models, values can range from 0 to 24,576 or -1 for dynamic thinking. For 2.5 Pro model, values must be between 1 and 24,576; setting 0 is not allowed.

nodes.name: Print N Rows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output
nodes.details:
Print N Rows Node Details


This node is used to print the first N rows from the incoming dataframe.

The Number of rows that needs to be printed can be configured in the node.

Input Parameters

  • OUTPUT STORAGE LEVEL : Keep this as DEFAULT.
  • TITLE : Enter a short description for the type of information being displayed.
  • NUM ROWS TO PRINT : Set an integer value(N) which controls the number of rows to be displayed(Default N=10).
  • DISPLAY DATA TYPE : Shows the output dataframe column datatypes by default.

Output

  • This node can be used to view, analyze and validate the output of the Dataframe.
nodes.examples:
when input 5 in no of rows,it will show first 5 rows of the table as follows

PartID SupplierID PartName

P9271 S798 Part_D
P523 S955 Part_K
P3201 S332 Part_M
P9634 S527 Part_G
P9345 S850 Part_M

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: n
fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed

fields.name: displayDataType
fields.title: Display Data Type
fields.description: If true display rows DataType

report.pdf | This is page 2 of the report... | 2 | iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUg...

- report.pdf (a 2-page PDF document)
- notes.txt (a plain text file)
- proposal.docx (a Microsoft Word document)
- chart.png (an image file with text)

The DocumentToText node is configured as follows:
  • Directory/File Path: /data/documents/
  • Document Type: ["pdf", "txt", "docx", "image"] (process all supported types)
  • Select Image Column: Empty (no specific image column; uses file path for images)
  • Image Encoding: true (includes base64-encoded data for PDFs and images)
  • Recursive: false (processes only files in the specified directory)
  • Save Images Directory Path: /data/output/images/

Output:

The node processes the files and produces a DataFrame with the following structure:

fileName | content | pageNumber | base64ImageData
---------------|--------------------------------------|------------|----------------------------------
report.pdf | This is page 1 of the report... | 1 | iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUg...
report.pdf | This is page 2 of the report... | 2 | iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUg...
notes.txt | Meeting notes: discuss project... | 1 | null
proposal.docx | Proposal for new project... | 1 | null
chart.png | Sales: Q1 2025... | 1 | iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUg...

Explanation:

- The report.pdf file is processed, extracting text from both pages, resulting in two rows (one per page). With Image Encoding set to true, each page is also converted to a base64-encoded image in the base64ImageData column.
- The notes.txt file is processed as a single-page document, with its text extracted into the content column. No base64 encoding is applied, so base64ImageData is null.
- The proposal.docx file is processed, extracting its text content into a single row. No base64 encoding is applied, so base64ImageData is null.
- The chart.png file is processed using OCR to extract text, and its base64-encoded image data is included in the base64ImageData column.
- Extracted images from the PDF and PNG files are saved to /data/output/images/.
- Since Recursive is set to false, only files directly in /data/documents/ are processed.

nodes.name: DocumentToText
nodes.description: The DocumentToText node extracts text content from documents, including PDF, TXT, DOCX, and image files, located in a specified file path or directory. It processes either a single file or an entire directory, producing a structured DataFrame with columns for the extracted text, file name, page numbers, and optionally, base64-encoded data for PDFs and images.
nodes.details:
DocumentToText Node Details


The DocumentToText node extracts text content from documents, including PDF, TXT, DOCX, and image files, located in a specified file path or directory. It processes either a single file or an entire directory, producing a structured DataFrame with columns for the extracted text, file name, page numbers, and optionally, base64-encoded data for PDFs and images.


General:



Directory/File Path:
Specifies the path to a single document file or a directory containing multiple documents. This field is required and must be accessible to the PySpark engine.

Document Type:
Selects the types of documents to process. Options include:

  • pdf: Processes PDF files, extracting text and optionally converting pages to base64-encoded images.
  • txt: Processes plain text files, extracting text only.
  • docx: Processes Microsoft Word documents, extracting text only.
  • image: Processes image files (e.g., PNG, JPEG) for text extraction via OCR, with optional base64 encoding.
If left empty, the node processes all supported file types (PDF, TXT, DOCX, and images) in the specified path.


Select Image Column:
Specifies a column containing paths to image files when processing images. This is optional and only required if image paths are provided in a DataFrame column rather than the directory path.

Image Encoding:
Determines whether to include a column with base64-encoded data for PDFs and images. Options are:
  • true: Adds a column with base64-encoded representations of PDF pages and image files.
  • false: Does not include base64-encoded data (default).
Note: TXT and DOCX files are not converted to base64 encodings, even if this option is enabled.


Recursive Processing:


Recursive:
Controls whether the node processes documents in subdirectories. Options are:
  • true: Recursively processes all documents in the specified directory and its subdirectories.
  • false: Processes only documents directly in the specified directory (default).

Output Storage:


Save Images Directory Path:
Specifies a directory path to save extracted images (for PDFs and image files) when Image Encoding is enabled. This is optional and relevant for storing extracted image data.

Output:


The node outputs a DataFrame with the following default columns:

  • fileName: The name of the source file.
  • content: The extracted text content from the document.
  • pageNumber:> The page number of the extracted content (for multi-page documents like PDFs; single-page documents like TXT, DOCX, and images use page number 1).
  • If Image Encoding is set to true, a base64ImageData column is included for PDFs and images, containing base64-encoded representations of the pages or images. TXT and DOCX files will have null in this column.
nodes.examples:
Example: DocumentToText Node


Input:

A directory /data/documents/ contains the following files:
- report.pdf (a 2-page PDF document)
- notes.txt (a plain text file)
- proposal.docx (a Microsoft Word document)
- chart.png (an image file with text)

The DocumentToText node is configured as follows:
  • Directory/File Path: /data/documents/
  • Document Type: ["pdf", "txt", "docx", "image"] (process all supported types)
  • Select Image Column: Empty (no specific image column; uses file path for images)
  • Image Encoding: true (includes base64-encoded data for PDFs and images)
  • Recursive: false (processes only files in the specified directory)
  • Save Images Directory Path: /data/output/images/

Output:

The node processes the files and produces a DataFrame with the following structure:

fileName | content | pageNumber | base64ImageData
---------------|--------------------------------------|------------|----------------------------------
report.pdf | This is page 1 of the report... | 1 | iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUg...
report.pdf | This is page 2 of the report... | 2 | iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUg...
notes.txt | Meeting notes: discuss project... | 1 | null
proposal.docx | Proposal for new project... | 1 | null
chart.png | Sales: Q1 2025... | 1 | iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUg...

Explanation:

- The report.pdf file is processed, extracting text from both pages, resulting in two rows (one per page). With Image Encoding set to true, each page is also converted to a base64-encoded image in the base64ImageData column.
- The notes.txt file is processed as a single-page document, with its text extracted into the content column. No base64 encoding is applied, so base64ImageData is null.
- The proposal.docx file is processed, extracting its text content into a single row. No base64 encoding is applied, so base64ImageData is null.
- The chart.png file is processed using OCR to extract text, and its base64-encoded image data is included in the base64ImageData column.
- Extracted images from the PDF and PNG files are saved to /data/output/images/.
- Since Recursive is set to false, only files directly in /data/documents/ are processed.

nodes.name: Multi LLM Query
nodes.description: The Multi LLM Query node is designed to query multiple large language models (LLMs) from providers such as OpenAI, Bedrock, and Gemini, using a DataFrame as input. It processes user queries, text content, and/or base64-encoded images to generate responses based on the selected model and task, producing a structured DataFrame output.
nodes.details:
Multi LLM Query Node Details


The Multi LLM Query node is designed to query multiple large language models (LLMs) from providers such as OpenAI, Bedrock, and Gemini, using a DataFrame as input. It processes user queries, text content, and/or base64-encoded images to generate responses based on the selected model and task, producing a structured DataFrame output.

General:


Select Task:

Specifies the task to perform. Options include:
- summary: Generates a summary of the content in bullet points.
- translation: Translates the content to English.
- topic_extraction: Extracts key topics from the content.
- other: Allows for a custom task defined by the user.

Prompt:

Allows users to provide a custom prompt / instructions for the selected task.

Content Column:

Specifies the DataFrame column containing the text content to be processed. Required for text or text+image modes.

Model Selection:

Selects the LLM provider to use. Options are:
- openai: Uses OpenAI models (e.g., gpt-4o).
- bedrock: Uses AWS Bedrock models (e.g., Claude models).
- gemini: Uses Google Gemini models (e.g., gemini-1.5-flash-latest).

Select Connection:

Specifies the connection details for the selected LLM provider (e.g., API keys for OpenAI/Gemini, AWS credentials for Bedrock). Required to authenticate and access the chosen model.

Temperature:

Controls the randomness of the LLM's output. Default is 0.7. Higher values increase creativity, while lower values ensure more deterministic responses.

Image Column:

Specifies the DataFrame column containing base64-encoded images. Required for image or text+image modes.

Mode Selection:

Determines the input mode for the LLM. Options are:
- text: Processes text-only input from the content column or custom prompt.
- image: Processes base64-encoded images from the image column.
- text+image: Processes both text and base64-encoded images.

Timeout (seconds):

Specifies the maximum time (in seconds) to wait for the model response. Visible when OpenAI or Gemini is selected.

Thinking Budget:

Controls the computational budget (e.g., steps or tokens) for Gemini models. Only visible when Gemini is selected.

Advanced:


Aggregate Response:

Specifies how to aggregate input data before processing. Options are:
- none: Processes each row individually, retaining fileName and pageNumber (if provided).
- all: Aggregates all rows into a single response.
- perfile: Aggregates rows by fileName, producing one response per file.

Number of Partitions:

Specifies the number of Spark partitions for distributed processing. Default is 3.

File Name Column:

Specifies the DataFrame column containing file names. Required for perfile aggregation mode.

Page Number Column:

Specifies the DataFrame column containing page numbers (e.g., for PDFs). Optional, used for row-wise processing with none aggregation mode.

Output:

The node outputs a DataFrame with columns based on the aggregation mode:
- none: Includes fileName (if provided), pageNumber (if provided), and response.
- perfile: Includes fileName and response.
- all: Includes only the response column.
The response column contains the LLM-generated text or error messages if the API call fails.
nodes.examples:
Multi LLM Query Node Examples


Input:

A DataFrame contains the following data:
- fileName: ["doc1.pdf", "doc1.pdf", "doc2.pdf"]
- pageNumber: ["1", "2", null]
- content: ["Article about climate change...", "Climate change impacts...", "Renewable energy report..."]
- imageBase64: [null, "iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUg...", null]

The Multi LLM Query node is configured as follows:
- Select Task: summary
- Prompt: "Summarize the content in bullet points."
- Content Column: content
- Model Selection: openai
- Select Connection: Configured with valid OpenAI API key
- Temperature: 0.7
- Timeout (seconds): 90
- Image Column: imageBase64
- Mode Selection: text+image
- Aggregate Response: perfile
- Number of Partitions: 3
- File Name Column: fileName
- Page Number Column: pageNumber

Output:

The node processes the DataFrame and produces a DataFrame with the following structure:
- fileName: doc1.pdf
response:
- Climate change effects on ecosystems
- Rising temperatures

- fileName: doc2.pdf
response:
- Renewable energy advancements
- Solar and wind adoption

fields.description: Configure the Gemini thinking budget by specifying the number of tokens to allocate for thinking. For Flash and Flash Lite models, values can range from 0 to 24,576 or -1 for dynamic thinking. For 2.5 Pro model, values must be between 1 and 24,576; setting 0 is not allowed.

fields.description: Configure the Gemini thinking budget by specifying the number of tokens to allocate for thinking. For Flash and Flash Lite models, values can range from 0 to 24,576 or -1 for dynamic thinking. For 2.5 Pro model, values must be between 1 and 24,576; setting 0 is not allowed.

nodes.name: Multi LLM Query
nodes.description: The Multi LLM Query node is designed to query multiple large language models (LLMs) from providers such as OpenAI, Bedrock, and Gemini, using a DataFrame as input. It processes user queries, text content, and/or base64-encoded images to generate responses based on the selected model and task, producing a structured DataFrame output.
nodes.details:
Multi LLM Query Node Details


The Multi LLM Query node is designed to query multiple large language models (LLMs) from providers such as OpenAI, Bedrock, and Gemini, using a DataFrame as input. It processes user queries, text content, and/or base64-encoded images to generate responses based on the selected model and task, producing a structured DataFrame output.

General:


Select Task:

Specifies the task to perform. Options include:
- summary: Generates a summary of the content in bullet points.
- translation: Translates the content to English.
- topic_extraction: Extracts key topics from the content.
- other: Allows for a custom task defined by the user.

Prompt:

Allows users to provide a custom prompt / instructions for the selected task.

Content Column:

Specifies the DataFrame column containing the text content to be processed. Required for text or text+image modes.

Model Selection:

Selects the LLM provider to use. Options are:
- openai: Uses OpenAI models (e.g., gpt-4o).
- bedrock: Uses AWS Bedrock models (e.g., Claude models).
- gemini: Uses Google Gemini models (e.g., gemini-1.5-flash-latest).

Select Connection:

Specifies the connection details for the selected LLM provider (e.g., API keys for OpenAI/Gemini, AWS credentials for Bedrock). Required to authenticate and access the chosen model.

Temperature:

Controls the randomness of the LLM's output. Default is 0.7. Higher values increase creativity, while lower values ensure more deterministic responses.

Image Column:

Specifies the DataFrame column containing base64-encoded images. Required for image or text+image modes.

Mode Selection:

Determines the input mode for the LLM. Options are:
- text: Processes text-only input from the content column or custom prompt.
- image: Processes base64-encoded images from the image column.
- text+image: Processes both text and base64-encoded images.

Timeout (seconds):

Specifies the maximum time (in seconds) to wait for the model response. Visible when OpenAI or Gemini is selected.

Thinking Budget:

Controls the computational budget (e.g., steps or tokens) for Gemini models. Only visible when Gemini is selected.

Advanced:


Aggregate Response:

Specifies how to aggregate input data before processing. Options are:
- none: Processes each row individually, retaining fileName and pageNumber (if provided).
- all: Aggregates all rows into a single response.
- perfile: Aggregates rows by fileName, producing one response per file.

Number of Partitions:

Specifies the number of Spark partitions for distributed processing. Default is 3.

File Name Column:

Specifies the DataFrame column containing file names. Required for perfile aggregation mode.

Page Number Column:

Specifies the DataFrame column containing page numbers (e.g., for PDFs). Optional, used for row-wise processing with none aggregation mode.

Output:

The node outputs a DataFrame with columns based on the aggregation mode:
- none: Includes fileName (if provided), pageNumber (if provided), and response.
- perfile: Includes fileName and response.
- all: Includes only the response column.
The response column contains the LLM-generated text or error messages if the API call fails.
nodes.examples:
Multi LLM Query Node Examples


Input:

A DataFrame contains the following data:
- fileName: ["doc1.pdf", "doc1.pdf", "doc2.pdf"]
- pageNumber: ["1", "2", null]
- content: ["Article about climate change...", "Climate change impacts...", "Renewable energy report..."]
- imageBase64: [null, "iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUg...", null]

The Multi LLM Query node is configured as follows:
- Select Task: summary
- Prompt: "Summarize the content in bullet points."
- Content Column: content
- Model Selection: openai
- Select Connection: Configured with valid OpenAI API key
- Temperature: 0.7
- Timeout (seconds): 90
- Image Column: imageBase64
- Mode Selection: text+image
- Aggregate Response: perfile
- Number of Partitions: 3
- File Name Column: fileName
- Page Number Column: pageNumber

Output:

The node processes the DataFrame and produces a DataFrame with the following structure:
- fileName: doc1.pdf
response:
- Climate change effects on ecosystems
- Rising temperatures

- fileName: doc2.pdf
response:
- Renewable energy advancements
- Solar and wind adoption

fields.value: Ensure that no extra spaces, delimiters, comments, or explanations are added. Replace "important_word" values dynamically based on the conversation, but always keep this compact JSON structure.

nodes.name: Print N Rows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output
nodes.details:
Print N Rows Node Details


This node is used to print the first N rows from the incoming dataframe.

The Number of rows that needs to be printed can be configured in the node.

Input Parameters

  • OUTPUT STORAGE LEVEL : Keep this as DEFAULT.
  • TITLE : Enter a short description for the type of information being displayed.
  • NUM ROWS TO PRINT : Set an integer value(N) which controls the number of rows to be displayed(Default N=10).
  • DISPLAY DATA TYPE : Shows the output dataframe column datatypes by default.

Output

  • This node can be used to view, analyze and validate the output of the Dataframe.
nodes.examples:
when input 5 in no of rows,it will show first 5 rows of the table as follows

PartID SupplierID PartName

P9271 S798 Part_D
P523 S955 Part_K
P3201 S332 Part_M
P9634 S527 Part_G
P9345 S850 Part_M

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: n
fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed

fields.name: displayDataType
fields.title: Display Data Type
fields.description: If true display rows DataType
